title: 114_hr3869
content: The Act titled "State and Local Cyber Protection Act of 2015" focuses on coordinating cybersecurity efforts between state and local governments with the National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new subsection focusing on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. This involves assisting State and local governments in identifying information system vulnerabilities and security protections against cybersecurity risks. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new subsection focusing on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. This involves providing tools, resources, and guidelines for information security to State and local governments. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new subsection focusing on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. This involves working with senior State and local government officials to coordinate a nationwide effort to ensure effective implementation of tools, products, resources, policies, guidelines, and procedures related to information security. Additionally, providing operational and technical cybersecurity training to State and local government and fusion center analysts and operators upon request. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new subsection focusing on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. This involves providing privacy and civil liberties training to State and local governments, as well as operational and technical assistance to implement cybersecurity tools and resources. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new subsection focusing on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. This involves assisting State and local governments in diagnosing and mitigating cyber threats, analyzing information security data, and conducting targeted evaluations on information systems. Additionally, it aims to help develop policies for coordinating vulnerability disclosures in line with industry standards. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new subsection focusing on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. This involves ensuring that State and local governments are aware of information security standards and resources developed by federal departments, including the National Institute of Standards and Technology. Training on privacy and civil liberties will also be provided in accordance with the Department's guidelines. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to include a new subsection focusing on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. This involves processes consistent with the Department's Fair Information Practice Principles to limit the receipt, retention, use, and disclosure of information related to cybersecurity risks and incidents. The new subsection in the Homeland Security Act of 2002 focuses on State and Local Coordination on Cybersecurity. It includes measures to safeguard cyber threat indicators and defensive measures, ensuring data integrity and minimizing impact on privacy and civil liberties. The new subsection in the Homeland Security Act of 2002 emphasizes protecting sensitive information from unauthorized access, safeguarding cyber threat indicators, and ensuring constitutional and legal protections are upheld. Congressional oversight is required to assess the effectiveness of these activities within two years of the Act's enactment. The Senate Governmental Affairs committee will evaluate the effectiveness of cybersecurity activities under the Homeland Security Act of 2002, focusing on State and local information security. Feedback from State and local governments will be included in the assessment. The House of Representatives passed the information required under this subsection on December 10, 2015, as attested by Clerk KAREN L. HAAS.
